{"step_by_step_thinking": "The first step in removing any occlusal pre-maturity should be to check the occlusion in centric. This is because the centric occlusion is the position where all the teeth in the mouth make contact with each other and it is the most stable and repeatable position. Any discrepancies in this position can lead to occlusal pre-maturity. Therefore, before checking for working or non-working interferences, it is important to first ensure that the occlusion in centric is correct.", "answer_choice": "C. Check the occlusion in centric."}
